trans-unit.source: Specifies the calling conventions of functions that are generated by the JScript compiler.
Used with the <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttribute"></xref> custom attribute.
The parameters associated with HasArguments, HasEngine, and HasThisObject are implicit and are automatically provided by the JScript runtime when the function is called from JScript code.

Specifies the aggregate of <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasArguments"></xref>, <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasEngine"></xref>, and <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasThisObject"></xref>.
Specifies the aggregate of <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.ClassicFunction"></xref> and <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.NestedFunction"></xref>.
Specifies that the third parameter of the function is of type `Object`.
The caller should pass in an object that implements the JScript arguments object, typically an instance of <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.ArgumentsObject"></xref>.

The JScript runtime assumes that if <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasArguments"></xref> is set, then <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasStackFrame"></xref> and <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasThisObject"></xref> are also set.
Specifies that the second parameter of the function is of type <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine"></xref>.
The caller should pass in an instance of <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine"></xref> from which the function can retrieve the runtime infrastructure.

The JScript runtime assumes that if <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasEngine"></xref> is set then <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasThisObject"></xref> is also set.
Specifies that the function copies its local variables into a stack frame object maintained by the JScript runtime before making a call out.
It copies the variables back from the stack frame object to its locals when control is returned to the function.
This flag is set on functions that contain nested functions that access the parent function's locals.
Specifies that the first parameter of the function is of type `Object` and that it is usually named thisob.
The caller should pass in an instance of the object that the function acts on.
Specifies that the function takes a variable number of arguments.
The last parameter is of type array of `Object`, which holds any arguments that are explicitly specified.
Specifies that the function is a constructor function for a prototype-based object.

For more information, see [Prototype-based Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ef504099-8026-485e-8c70-c5246b548b94) and [expando Modifier](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/079e089b-a6ab-43f2-8585-78791d7b5c43).
Specifies that the function is a constructor for a nested instance class.
The first parameter of the function an instance of the parent class.
Specifies that the function is nested in another JScript function.

Specifies the aggregate of <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasStackFrame"></xref>, <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.IsNested"></xref>, and <xref href="Microsoft.JScript.JSFunctionAttributeEnum.HasEngine"></xref>.
Specifies a regular .NET Framework method with no special calling conventions.
Typically not used as in this case the JSFunctionAttribute is not emitted.
